subject: Politics
title: Universal Basic Income
description: A micro-lesson that makes Universal Basic Income usable.

hook.text: What if the government paid everyone a basic income with no conditions? Experiments suggest it actually works.

buildup.text: UBI means giving every citizen a regular cash payment regardless of employment or wealth. No strings attached.

discovery.text: Finland's UBI trial found recipients were happier and healthier. Employment didn't drop as critics feared.

twist.text: AI and automation may make UBI necessary. If machines take most jobs, how do people earn a living?

climax.text: UBI costs trillions. Funding it means higher taxes or redirecting existing welfare. The politics are daunting.

punchline.text: UBI sounds radical. Mass unemployment without it may be worse.

quiz.question: What did Finland's UBI experiment find?
options: Recipients were happier and healthier without reduced employment
